text: bill gates you make a very bold
prediction in your letter you say that
within 15 years the world will discover
a new source of energy how can you be so
confident well it'd be fantastic if we
do because we have this incredible
challenge that billions of people don't
have energy and yet the way we make
energy today is causing climate change
there's a lot of great science going on
a lot of great paths that we can go down
a number of governments committed to
double their energy research and
development and we have a lot of great
scientific capability so yes I'm
optimistic that a new path will be
created and let us solve this problem
I'm Melinda Gates if that happened if
there was a new source of clean energy
what difference would that make to the
women across the world who have to do
these lengthy household chores without
electricity or running water well that's
why I was glad that bill wrote so much
about clean cheap energy for the
developing world because women spend
globally a hundred and twenty-five
million hours every day carrying water
women cook four hours a day and I've
been in these smoke-filled huts and what
it means is that they spend all this
time carrying water or creating a fire
chopping wood they don't have time to
participate in the economy they pull
their daughters out of school to do this
work and so all of that time that goes
into those chores means that doesn't go
into other productive things that they
can do in society turning to the
question of the Zika virus when you see
the Zika virus spreading so rapidly
across Latin America particularly in
Brazil what do you think needs to be
done to stop it there are ways of
reducing the number of mosquitoes or
changing the mosquitoes so they don't
carry these viruses and the global
health community including our
foundation is getting together and
saying urgently how quickly can we get
money behind this and these new
techniques work in the laboratory how
quickly could we get them out in the
field so I do think there will be
solutions that largely involve bringing
the mosquito populations down but we
won't solve it as quickly as as people
want us to because these things take
take years to helpful
fact just a final question if I could
bill gates because your hair as the
founder of Microsoft do you think Apple
is right to resist the US government's
demand that it unlock the iPhones of the
San Bernardino killers well I think we
expect governments to find out
everything they can about terrorism
particularly when we the threat not just
a conventional terrorism but nuclear and
biological terrorism and making sure
people are comfortable with the way
governments handle that information so
it's really there to protect them that's
worth having a debate but you know
should government be able to to access
information at all or should they be
blind that's essentially what we're
talking about Bill and Melinda Gates
thank you very much for joining us thank
you
